title: PROP (category theory)
summary: In category theory, a branch of mathematics, a PROP is a symmetric strict monoidal category whose objects are the natural numbers n identified with the finite sets { 0 , 1 , … , n − 1 } {\displaystyle \{0,1,\ldots ,n-1\}} and whose tensor product is given on objects by the addition on numbers.[1] Because of “symmetric”, for each n, the symmetric group on n letters is given as a subgroup of the automorphism group of n. The name PROP is an abbreviation of "PROduct and Permutation category".
